alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:57AM AKST until January 22 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW FROM PELICAN TO JUNEAU FOR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY... .A heavy band of snow from a stationary front looks to set up from Pelican to Juneau Sunday through Monday, with the greatest rates Sunday night through Monday. Resilient cold air from the north is expected to remain in place through much of the event, keeping precipitation as snow. Moisture transport appears to hit Juneau the hardest, prompting the highest snow totals. At this time, snow looks to fully transition to a wintry mix and rain early Tuesday morning. However, this transition will depend on how fast the incoming front can break through the cold air. It is possible that this event will be long duration. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 7 inches. * WHERE...Admiralty Island and Western Kupreanof Island and Kuiu Island, including Angoon and Kake. * WHEN...From noon today to 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to increase in water content through the duration of the event, becoming increasingly heavy and wet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
